alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:20PM EDT until September 07 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MORRIS COUNTY... At 720 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mountain Lakes, or 8 miles north of Morristown, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Morris Plains, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Parsippany, Pequannock Township, Lake Telemark, Green Pond, Hanover Township and White Meadow Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 39 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 38 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
